intro: Calendula aurantiaca, commonly known as the orange marigold, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its vibrant, orange-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lobed leaves. Its flowers are composed of ray florets and disc florets, which attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Calendula aurantiaca is often used in traditional medicine and as a natural dye due to its rich pigments.
